questions.text: Which of the following is not true regarding laparoscopic hernia repair?

options.label: A
options.text: Local anesthesia with sedation is the most common form of anesthesia used.

options.label: B
options.text: It could lead to injury to the genitofemoral nerve and the lateral femoral cutaneous nerve.

options.label: C
options.text: Transabdominal preperitoneal or total extraperitoneal approaches are commonly used.

options.label: D
options.text: It is best suited for recurrent and bilateral hernias.

questions.correct_answer: A. Local anesthesia with sedation is the most common form of anesthesia used.

questions.text: Modern therapy for breast cancer focuses on molecular markers to help guide treatment strategies. Which of the following statements is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Carriers of the BRCA2 mutation are more likely to have triple-negative cancers.

options.label: B
options.text: Human epidermal growth factor receptor (HER)-2–positive cancers are unlikely to respond to treatment with trastuzumab.

options.label: C
options.text: Estrogen receptor (ER)-positive/HER-2–negative patients should be treated with endocrine therapy.

options.label: D
options.text: All breast cancers are sensitive to endocrine therapy.

questions.correct_answer: C. Estrogen receptor (ER)-positive/HER-2–negative patients should be treated with endocrine therapy.

questions.text: A 57-year-old woman with a 1.5-cm infiltrating ductal carcinoma and a clinically negative axilla is found to be ER negative, PR negative, and HER-2/neu positive. She comes to your office to discuss treatment options. What would you recommend?

options.label: A
options.text: Wide local excision, SLNB, radiation therapy, and adjuvant chemotherapy with trastuzumab

options.label: B
options.text: Wide local excision, radiation therapy, and tamoxifen

options.label: C
options.text: Simple mastectomy, SLNB, trastuzumab (Herceptin), and tamoxifen

options.label: D
options.text: Modified radical mastectomy and adjuvant chemotherapy

questions.correct_answer: A. Wide local excision, SLNB, radiation therapy, and adjuvant chemotherapy with trastuzumab

questions.text: An 11-year-old girl presents to your office because of a lesion on the tongue (shown in picture). Her mother has past history of total thyroidectomy. Other physical examination is normal. Which of the following tests should you perform?

options.label: A
options.text: Urine vanillylmandelic acid (VMA) level

options.label: B
options.text: Serum insulin level

options.label: C
options.text: Serum gastrin level

options.label: D
options.text: Serum glucagon level

questions.correct_answer: A. Urine vanillylmandelic acid (VMA) level

questions.text: Which of the following patients meets criteria for bariatric surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: A 37-year-old woman with poorly controlled type 2 diabetes (HbA1c = 11.7) and a BMI of 34

options.label: B
options.text: A 42-year-old man with well-controlled depression and type 2 diabetes (HbA1c = 6.7) and a BMI of 38

options.label: C
options.text: A 28-year-old female with asthma, hyperlipidemia, alcohol abuse, and a BMI of 42

options.label: D
options.text: A 19-year-old man with Prader-Willi syndrome and a BMI of 48

questions.correct_answer: B. A 42-year-old man with well-controlled depression and type 2 diabetes (HbA1c = 6.7) and a BMI of 38

questions.text: A 28-year-old male presents with symptoms of dysphagia to solids and liquids with regurgitation. Esophogography shows distal narrowing to a point(fig). What is the most likely finding on high-resolution manometry?

options.label: A
options.text: Aperistalsis without relaxation of the LES with deglutition

options.label: B
options.text: Uncoordinated peristalsis

options.label: C
options.text: Esophageal pressure of 250 mmHg

options.label: D
options.text: LES pressure 20 mmHg

questions.correct_answer: A. Aperistalsis without relaxation of the LES with deglutition

questions.text: All of the following statements regarding the treatment of papillary thyroid cancer are true except?

options.label: A
options.text: Total thyroidectomy is indicated for cancers greater than 4 cm in greatest dimension and for smaller cancers with adverse features such as a history of radiation exposure.

options.label: B
options.text: Reoperation is indicated for completion thyroidectomy for patients who have a papillary thyroid cancer with poorly differentiated discovered on permanent section pathology after thyroid lobectomy.

options.label: C
options.text: Prophylactic lateral compartment neck dissection (ipsilateral modified radical neck dissection) is indicated in most cases.

options.label: D
options.text: After resection, exogenous thyroid hormone should be titrated to achieve a subnormal thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH).

questions.correct_answer: C. Prophylactic lateral compartment neck dissection (ipsilateral modified radical neck dissection) is indicated in most cases.

questions.text: A 27-year-old man with a long-standing history of Crohn’s disease is noted to have several extraintestinal manifestations of Crohn’s disease including erythema nodosum, arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, anemia, and episodes of pancreatitis. During evaluation of his right lower quadrant pain, he is found to have a segment of thickened ileum causing obstruction. Which extraintestinal manifestations of his Crohn’s disease would you not expect to subside after resection of the involved segment of bowel?

options.label: A
options.text: Erythema nodosum

options.label: B
options.text: Arthritis

options.label: C
options.text: Ankylosing spondylitis

options.label: D
options.text: Anemia

questions.correct_answer: C. Ankylosing spondylitis

questions.text: A 36-year-old woman presents with palpitations, anxiety, and hypertension. Workup reveals a pheochromocytoma. Which of the following is the best approach to optimizing the patient preoperatively?

options.label: A
options.text: Fluid restriction 24 hours preoperatively to prevent intraoperative congestive heart failure

options.label: B
options.text: Initiation of an α-blocker 24 hours prior to surgery

options.label: C
options.text: Initiation of an α-blocker at 1 to 3 weeks prior to surgery

options.label: D
options.text: Initiation of a β-blocker 1 to 3 weeks prior to surgery

questions.correct_answer: C. Initiation of an α-blocker at 1 to 3 weeks prior to surgery

questions.text: A 54-year-old man is being assessed for colicky abdominal pain and occasional nonbilious emesis. He denies fevers and does not have leukocytosis. He has a history of melanoma that was resected from his arm 5 years earlier. His upper GI (UGI) radiograph is shown in Fig. What is the next best step in this patient’s management?

options.label: A
options.text: Barium enema with pneumatic decompression

options.label: B
options.text: Exploratory laparotomy and manual reduction

options.label: C
options.text: Exploratory laparotomy, manual reduction, and resection of the involved segment

options.label: D
options.text: Nasogastric tube placement, intravenous fluid, and a trial of nonoperative management

questions.correct_answer: C. Exploratory laparotomy, manual reduction, and resection of the involved segment

questions.text: A woman is undergoing an open incisional hernia repair through a previous cesarean section incision. During the operation, this structure (Fig.) is noted about 60 cm from the ileocecal valve. What is true regarding this incidental finding?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a true diverticulum.

options.label: B
options.text: This lesion may be found in various anatomic forms in 50% of the population.

options.label: C
options.text: Pancreatic tissue is the most common ectopic tissue found in this diverticula.

options.label: D
options.text: Most complications occur in the elderly.

questions.correct_answer: A. It is a true diverticulum.

questions.text: A 28-year-old man presents with a left testicular mass that is 2.8 × 1.4 cm on ultrasound. CT abdomen/pelvis shows enlarged para-aortic lymph nodes (long axis is 2.5 cm, short axis is 1.5 cm) around the left renal hilum. Tumor markers, including alpha-fetoprotein (AFP), beta-human chorionic gonadotropin (beta-HCG), and lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) are obtained and all are normal. He undergoes radical inguinal orchiectomy and is found to have a mixed seminoma (95%) and embryonal carcinoma (5%). He is noted to have spermatic cord involvement. One month after orchiectomy, tumor markers remain negative. What is the diagnosis and next step in treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Seminoma; Surveillance

options.label: B
options.text: Seminoma; Radiation to ipsilateral iliac and paraaortic lymph node

options.label: C
options.text: Nonseminoma; 1 to 2 cycles of BEP (bleomycin/etoposide/cisplatin) chemotherapy

options.label: D
options.text: Nonseminoma; Bilateral nerve-sparing retroperitoneal lymph node dissection

questions.correct_answer: D. Nonseminoma; Bilateral nerve-sparing retroperitoneal lymph node dissection

questions.text: At which age should the following defect be repaired?

options.label: A
options.text: 3 months

options.label: B
options.text: 3 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: 2 stages, 6 months and 12-15months

options.label: D
options.text: 6 months

questions.correct_answer: C. 2 stages, 6 months and 12-15months

questions.text: A 35-year-old male underwent a laparoscopic appendectomy. On final pathology, he was found to have a 1.4-cm carcinoid tumor in the mid-appendix with direct extension to the mesoappendix, negative margins, and no lymphovascular invasion. What is the best treatment plan?

options.label: A
options.text: No further treatment needed

options.label: B
options.text: Ileocecectomy

options.label: C
options.text: Right hemicolectomy

options.label: D
options.text: Medical treatment with octreotide

questions.correct_answer: C. Right hemicolectomy

questions.text: A 10-year-old boy presents to the emergency room with testicular pain of 5 h duration. The pain was of acute onset and woke the patient from sleep. On physical examination, he is noted to have a high- riding, indurated, and markedly tender left testis. Pain is not diminished by elevation. Urinalysis is unremarkable. Which of the following statements regarding the patient’s diagnosis and treatment is true?

options.label: A
options.text: There is a strong likelihood that this patient’s father or brother has had or will have a similar event

options.label: B
options.text: Operation should be delayed until a technetium scan clarifies the diagnosis

options.label: C
options.text: The majority of testicles that have undergone torsion can be salvaged if surgery is performed within 24 h

options.label: D
options.text: If torsion is found, both testes should undergo orchiopexy

questions.correct_answer: D. If torsion is found, both testes should undergo orchiopexy

questions.text: Which of the following findings warrants APR?

options.label: A
options.text: A fixed circumferential adenocarcinoma just above the dentate line

options.label: B
options.text: An ulcerating adenocarcinoma whose lower edge is 7 cm from the dentate line.

options.label: C
options.text: A 2-cm mobile adenocarcinoma arising in a villous adenoma 3 cm from the dentate line

options.label: D
options.text: A circumferential adenocarcinoma 12 cm from the anal verge

questions.correct_answer: A. A fixed circumferential adenocarcinoma just above the dentate line

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman is evaluated for pain with defecation. The pain started acutely after a large bowel movement, is extremely intense following the passage of any stool, and persists for several hours. She is barely able to tolerate examination, which demonstrates a small defect in the anoderm located at the posterior midline(fig). Which of the following statements regarding her condition is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Most lesions are located above the dentate line.

options.label: B
options.text: The lesions are always located at the posterior midline.

options.label: C
options.text: The operation of choice for this lesion is excision and posterior internal sphincterotomy.

options.label: D
options.text: Pharmacologic therapy with nitroglycerin, calcium channel blockers, or botulinum toxin may prove beneficial.

questions.correct_answer: D. Pharmacologic therapy with nitroglycerin, calcium channel blockers, or botulinum toxin may prove beneficial.

questions.text: What is the preferred site for needle entry in paracentesis?

options.label: A
options.text: 3 cm medial and 3 cm superior to the anterior superior iliac supine (ASIS) on either side

options.label: B
options.text: 3 cm medial and 3 cm superior to the ASIS in the right lower quadrant (RLQ)

options.label: C
options.text: 3 cm medial and 3 cm superior to the ASIS in the left lower quadrant (LLQ)

options.label: D
options.text: 3 cm medial to and at the level of the ASIS on either side

questions.correct_answer: C. 3 cm medial and 3 cm superior to the ASIS in the left lower quadrant (LLQ)

questions.text: A surgeon encounters difficulty during an elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy in a healthy 25-y/o woman and converts to an open procedure. The 4-mm common hepatic duct has been transected 1 cm below the bifurcation. Which of the following procedures is the most appropriate?

options.label: A
options.text: Duct-to-duct repair over a T-tube

options.label: B
options.text: Duct-to-duct repair without a stent

options.label: C
options.text: Roux-en-Y hepaticojejunostomy

options.label: D
options.text: Hepaticoduodenostomy

questions.correct_answer: C. Roux-en-Y hepaticojejunostomy

questions.text: A jaundiced, otherwise healthy patient is noted to have a 3-cm mass in the head of the pancreas on CT. EUS-guided fine-needle aspiration shows cancer. The mass abuts the portal vein, but there is no clear evidence of vessel involvement or metastatic disease. You proceed to the operating room. Intraoperatively, you are concerned about the resectability of the tumor. In which of the following situations is resection contraindicated?

options.label: A
options.text: 70?utment of the superior mesenteric artery

options.label: B
options.text: Tumor invading the portal vein

options.label: C
options.text: Inability to verify malignancy histologically before resection

options.label: D
options.text: 40?utment of the superior mesenteric vein

questions.correct_answer: A. 70?utment of the superior mesenteric artery

questions.text: A 27-year-old man presents to the ER after a high-speed motor vehicle collision with chest pain and marked respiratory distress. On physical examination, he is hypotensive with distended neck veins and absence of breath sounds in the left chest. E-FAST done shows following image Which of the following is the proper initial treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Intubation

options.label: B
options.text: Chest x-ray

options.label: C
options.text: Pericardiocentesis

options.label: D
options.text: Chest decompression with a needle

questions.correct_answer: D. Chest decompression with a needle

questions.text: What is the treatment for uncomplicated Stanford type B aortic dissections? CT image given below

options.label: A
options.text: Aggressive medical management

options.label: B
options.text: Open operative replacement of the ascending and descending aorta

options.label: C
options.text: Open operative replacement of the ascending aorta

options.label: D
options.text: Endovascular stent graft placement

questions.correct_answer: A. Aggressive medical management

questions.text: The CEAP classification is a formal system for classifying venous disease based on the Clinical picture, Etiology of the disease, Anatomic distribution, and Pathophysiology of venous disease. A patient with lipodermatosclerosis(fig) on physical examination of the lower extremity would be classified with which clinical stage?

A 34-year-old man is seen in the office with a 3-month history of a right-sided neck mass and pain with mastication. On examination, a 3-cm nontender mass is present at level II; it moves laterally but not in the craniocaudal direction. CT with intravenous (IV) contrast enhancement demonstrates a 3.5-cm mass at the carotid bifurcation. A follow-up angio- gram is obtained. Which of the following statements is most accurate regarding this case?

options.label: A
options.text: It represents the most common paraganglioma in the head and neck.

options.label: B
options.text: The rate of malignancy is about 40%.

options.label: C
options.text: The majority of these lesions show functional secretion of catecholamines.

options.label: D
options.text: A fine-needle aspiration biopsy (FNAB) is indicated to rule out malignancy.

questions.correct_answer: A. It represents the most common paraganglioma in the head and neck.

questions.text: A trauma resident receives a patient with a suspected brain injury. A Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) assessment is warranted. The patient’s eyes opened and arms goes as shown in pic when cuticle pressure (pain) was applied. The patient was producing some incomprehensible sounds. . What would be this patient’s GCS?
